a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Income or consumption of the poorest 10%, 2024
This is the level of income or consumption per person per day below which 10% of the population falls. This
data is adjusted for inflation and differences in the cost of living between countries.
Data source: World Bank Poverty and Inequality Platform (2024)
Note: This data is expressed in international-$ at 2017 prices. Depending on the country and year, it relates to income measured after taxes
and benefits, or to consumption, per capita.
